config_mobile_hotspot_provision_app_no_u.description: If the mobile hotspot feature requires provisioning, an action can be provided&#10;that will be broadcast in non-ui cases for checking the provisioning status.&#10;&#10;A second broadcast, action defined by config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response,&#10;will be sent back to notify if provisioning succeeded or not.  The response will&#10;match that of the activity in config_mobile_hotspot_provision_app, but instead&#10;contained within the int extra &quot;EntitlementResult&quot;.&#10;&#10;Example Usage:&#10;String provisionAction = getString(R.string.config_mobile_hotspot_provision_check);&#10;sendBroadcast(new Intent(provisionAction));&#10;&#10;public void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent) {&#10;    String provisionResponse =&#10;  getString(R.string.config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response);&#10;    if (provisionResponse.equals(intent.getAction())&#10;  &amp;&amp; intent.getIntExtra(&quot;EntitlementResult&quot;) == Activity.RESULT_OK) {&#10;        //Mobile hotspot provisioning successful&#10;    } else {&#10;        //Mobile hotspot provisioning failed&#10;    }&#10;}&#10;

config_mobile_hotspot_provision_check_pe.title: The config_mobile_hotspot_provision_check_period Schema
config_mobile_hotspot_provision_check_pe.description: Number of hours between each background provisioning call

config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response.title: The config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response Schema
config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response.description: Sent in response to a provisioning check. The caller must hold the&#10;permission android.permission.CONNECTIVITY_INTERNAL for Settings to&#10;receive this response.&#10;&#10;See config_mobile_hotspot_provision_response&#10;

config_mobile_mtu.title: The config_mobile_mtu Schema
config_mobile_mtu.description: Configure mobile network MTU. The standard default is set here but each carrier&#10;may have a specific value set in an overlay config.xml file.

config_mobile_tcp_buffers.title: The config_mobile_tcp_buffers Schema
config_mobile_tcp_buffers.description: Configure mobile tcp buffer sizes in the form:&#10;rat-name:rmem_min,rmem_def,rmem_max,wmem_min,wmem_def,wmem_max&#10;If no value is found for the rat-name in use, the system default will be applied.&#10;

config_navBarOpacityMode.title: The config_navBarOpacityMode Schema
config_navBarOpacityMode.description: Controls the opacity of the navigation bar depending on the visibility of the&#10;various workspace stacks.&#10;0 - Nav bar is always opaque when either the freeform stack or docked stack is visible.&#10;1 - Nav bar is always translucent when the freeform stack is visible, otherwise always&#10;opaque.&#10;

config_networkAvoidBadWifi.title: The config_networkAvoidBadWifi Schema
config_networkAvoidBadWifi.description: Whether the device should automatically switch away from Wi-Fi networks that lose&#10;Internet access. Actual device behaviour is controlled by&#10;Settings.Global.NETWORK_AVOID_BAD_WIFI. This is the default value of that setting.

config_networkLocationProviderPackageNam.title: The config_networkLocationProviderPackageName Schema
config_networkLocationProviderPackageNam.description: Package name providing network location support. Used only when&#10;config_enableNetworkLocationOverlay is false.

config_networkNotifySwitches.title: The config_networkNotifySwitches Schema
config_networkNotifySwitches.description: What types of network switches to notify. See LingerMonitor.java.

config_networkNotifySwitchType.title: The config_networkNotifySwitchType Schema
config_networkNotifySwitchType.description: Whether/how to notify the user on network switches. See LingerMonitor.java.

config_networkPolicyDefaultWarning.title: The config_networkPolicyDefaultWarning Schema
config_networkPolicyDefaultWarning.description: Default network policy warning threshold, in megabytes.

config_networkPolicyNotificationComponen.title: The config_networkPolicyNotificationComponent Schema
config_networkPolicyNotificationComponen.description: Name of the component to handle network policy notifications. If present,&#10;disables NetworkPolicyManagerService's presentation of data-usage notifications.

config_networkTransitionTimeout.title: The config_networkTransitionTimeout Schema
config_networkTransitionTimeout.description: The maximum duration (in milliseconds) we expect a network transition to take

config_nightDisplayAvailable.title: The config_nightDisplayAvailable Schema
config_nightDisplayAvailable.description: Control whether Night display is available. This should only be enabled on devices&#10;with HWC 2.0 or higher.

config_nonBlockableNotificationPackages.title: The config_nonBlockableNotificationPackages Schema
config_nonBlockableNotificationPackages.description: An array of packages for which notifications cannot be blocked.

config_notificationFallbackVibePattern.title: The config_notificationFallbackVibePattern Schema
config_notificationFallbackVibePattern.description: Vibrator pattern to be used as the default for notifications&#10;that do not specify vibration but vibrate anyway because the device&#10;is in vibrate mode.&#10;

config_notificationsBatteryFullARGB.title: The config_notificationsBatteryFullARGB Schema
config_notificationsBatteryFullARGB.description: Default value for led color when battery is fully charged

config_notificationsBatteryLedOff.title: The config_notificationsBatteryLedOff Schema
config_notificationsBatteryLedOff.description: Default value for LED off time when the battery is low on charge in miliseconds

config_notificationsBatteryLedOn.title: The config_notificationsBatteryLedOn Schema
config_notificationsBatteryLedOn.description: Default value for LED on time when the battery is low on charge in miliseconds

config_notificationsBatteryLowARGB.title: The config_notificationsBatteryLowARGB Schema
config_notificationsBatteryLowARGB.description: Default value for led color when battery is low on charge

config_notificationsBatteryMediumARGB.title: The config_notificationsBatteryMediumARGB Schema
config_notificationsBatteryMediumARGB.description: Default value for led color when battery is medium charged

config_notificationServiceArchiveSize.title: The config_notificationServiceArchiveSize Schema
config_notificationServiceArchiveSize.description: Number of notifications to keep in the notification service historical archive

config_notificationSignalExtractors.title: The config_notificationSignalExtractors Schema
config_notificationSignalExtractors.description: The list of classes that should be added to the notification ranking pipline.&#10;     See {@link com.android.server.notification.NotificationSignalExtractor}

config_ntpPollingIntervalShorter.title: The config_ntpPollingIntervalShorter Schema
config_ntpPollingIntervalShorter.description: Try-again polling interval in milliseconds, in case the network request failed

config_ntpRetry.title: The config_ntpRetry Schema
config_ntpRetry.description: Number of times to try again with the shorter interval, before backing&#10;off until the normal polling interval. A value &lt; 0 indicates infinite.

config_ntpServer.title: The config_ntpServer Schema
config_ntpServer.description: Remote server that can provide NTP responses.

config_ntpThreshold.title: The config_ntpThreshold Schema
config_ntpThreshold.description: If the time difference is greater than this threshold in milliseconds,&#10;then update the time.

config_ntpTimeout.title: The config_ntpTimeout Schema
config_ntpTimeout.description: Timeout to wait for NTP server response in milliseconds.

config_oemUsbModeOverride.title: The config_oemUsbModeOverride Schema
config_oemUsbModeOverride.description: Array of OEM specific USB mode override config.&#10;OEM can override a certain USB mode depending on ro.bootmode.&#10;Specify an array of below items to set override rule.&#10;[bootmode]:[original USB mode]:[USB mode used]

config_onlySingleDcAllowed.title: The config_onlySingleDcAllowed Schema
config_onlySingleDcAllowed.description: The list of ril radio technologies (see ServiceState.java) which only support&#10;a single data connection at one time.  This may change by carrier via&#10;overlays (some don't support multiple pdp on UMTS).  All unlisted radio&#10;tech types support unlimited types (practically only 2-4 used).

config_operatorConsideredDomesticRoaming.title: The config_operatorConsideredDomesticRoaming Schema
config_operatorConsideredDomesticRoaming.description: Array of numeric that operator considered as domestic roaming

config_operatorConsideredNonRoaming.title: The config_operatorConsideredNonRoaming Schema
config_operatorConsideredNonRoaming.description: Don't use roaming icon for considered operators.&#10;A match on config_sameNamedOperatorConsideredRoaming supersedes a match on this.&#10;Can use mcc or mcc+mnc as item. For example, 302 or 21407.&#10;If operators, 21404 and 21407, make roaming agreements, user of 21404 should not see&#10;the roaming icon as using 21407 network.&#10;To do this, add 21407 item to values-mcc214-mnc04/config.xml

config_overrideHasPermanentMenuKey.title: The config_overrideHasPermanentMenuKey Schema
config_overrideHasPermanentMenuKey.description: Override the default detection behavior for the framework method&#10;android.view.ViewConfiguration#hasPermanentMenuKey().&#10;Valid settings are:&#10;0 - No change. Use the default autodetection behavior.&#10;1 - The device DOES have a permanent menu key; ignore autodetection.&#10;2 - The device DOES NOT have a permanent menu key; ignore autodetection.

config_overrideRemoteViewsActivityTransi.title: The config_overrideRemoteViewsActivityTransition Schema
config_overrideRemoteViewsActivityTransi.description: If true, the transition for a RemoteViews is read from a resource instead of using the&#10;default scale-up transition.

config_packagedKeyboardName.title: The config_packagedKeyboardName Schema
config_packagedKeyboardName.description: The BT name of the keyboard packaged with the device. If this is defined, SystemUI will&#10;automatically try to pair with it when the device exits tablet mode.

config_permissionReviewRequired.title: The config_permissionReviewRequired Schema
config_permissionReviewRequired.description: Specifies whether the permissions needed by a legacy app should be&#10;reviewed before any of its components can run. A legacy app is one&#10;with targetSdkVersion &lt; 23, i.e apps using the old permission model.&#10;If review is not required, permissions are reviewed before the app&#10;is installed.

config_persistentDataPackageName.title: The config_persistentDataPackageName Schema
config_persistentDataPackageName.description: Flag indicating which package name can access the persistent data partition

config_pinnerCameraApp.title: The config_pinnerCameraApp Schema
config_pinnerCameraApp.description: True if camera app should be pinned via Pinner Service

config_powerDecoupleAutoSuspendModeFromD.title: The config_powerDecoupleAutoSuspendModeFromDisplay Schema
config_powerDecoupleAutoSuspendModeFromD.description: Power Management: Specifies whether to decouple the auto-suspend state of the&#10;device from the display on/off state.&#10;&#10;When false, autosuspend_disable() will be called before the display is turned on&#10;and autosuspend_enable() will be called after the display is turned off.&#10;This mode provides best compatibility for devices using legacy power management&#10;features such as early suspend / late resume.&#10;&#10;When true, autosuspend_display() and autosuspend_enable() will be called&#10;independently of whether the display is being turned on or off.  This mode&#10;enables the power manager to suspend the application processor while the&#10;display is on.&#10;&#10;This resource should be set to &quot;true&quot; when a doze component has been specified&#10;to maximize power savings but not all devices support it.&#10;&#10;Refer to autosuspend.h for details.&#10;

config_powerDecoupleInteractiveModeFromD.title: The config_powerDecoupleInteractiveModeFromDisplay Schema
config_powerDecoupleInteractiveModeFromD.description: Power Management: Specifies whether to decouple the interactive state of the&#10;device from the display on/off state.&#10;&#10;When false, setInteractive(..., true) will be called before the display is turned on&#10;and setInteractive(..., false) will be called after the display is turned off.&#10;This mode provides best compatibility for devices that expect the interactive&#10;state to be tied to the display state.&#10;&#10;When true, setInteractive(...) will be called independently of whether the display&#10;is being turned on or off.  This mode enables the power manager to reduce&#10;clocks and disable the touch controller while the display is on.&#10;&#10;This resource should be set to &quot;true&quot; when a doze component has been specified&#10;to maximize power savings but not all devices support it.&#10;&#10;Refer to power.h for details.&#10;

config_previousVibrationsDumpLimit.title: The config_previousVibrationsDumpLimit Schema
config_previousVibrationsDumpLimit.description: How long history of previous vibrations should be kept for the dumpsys.

config_protectedNetworks.title: The config_protectedNetworks Schema
config_protectedNetworks.description: Array of ConnectivityManager.TYPE_xxxx constants for networks that may only&#10;be controlled by systemOrSignature apps.

config_radio_access_family.title: The config_radio_access_family Schema
config_radio_access_family.description: The RadioAccessFamilies supported by the device.&#10;Empty is viewed as &quot;all&quot;.  Only used on devices which&#10;don't support RIL_REQUEST_GET_RADIO_CAPABILITY&#10;format is UMTS|LTE|...

config_radioScanningTimeout.title: The config_radioScanningTimeout Schema
config_radioScanningTimeout.description: The duration (in milliseconds) that the radio will scan for a signal&#10;when there's no network connection. If the scan doesn't timeout, use zero

config_regional_lte_singnal_threshold.title: The config_regional_lte_singnal_threshold Schema
config_regional_lte_singnal_threshold.description: Whether to use TMO LTE singnal strength threshold

config_regional_mcc_mnc_roaming_setting.title: The config_regional_mcc_mnc_roaming_setting Schema
config_regional_mcc_mnc_roaming_setting.description: Whether to use TMO MCC MNC roaming setting

config_regional_umts_singnal_threshold.title: The config_regional_umts_singnal_threshold Schema
config_regional_umts_singnal_threshold.description: Whether to use TMO UMTS singnal strength threshold

config_requireCallCapableAccountForHandl.title: The config_requireCallCapableAccountForHandle Schema
config_requireCallCapableAccountForHandl.description: Flag indicating that an outbound call must have a call capable phone account&#10;that has declared it can process the call's handle.

config_requireRadioPowerOffOnSimRefreshR.title: The config_requireRadioPowerOffOnSimRefreshReset Schema
config_requireRadioPowerOffOnSimRefreshR.description: Boolean indicating if RADIO POWER OFF is required on receiving SIM REFRESH with RESET.&#10;This will be handled by modem if it is false.

config_restart_radio_on_pdp_fail_regular.title: The config_restart_radio_on_pdp_fail_regular_deactivation Schema
config_restart_radio_on_pdp_fail_regular.description: Flag indicating whether radio is to be restarted on the error of&#10;PDP_FAIL_REGULAR_DEACTIVATION/0x24

config_restartRadioAfterProvisioning.title: The config_restartRadioAfterProvisioning Schema
config_restartRadioAfterProvisioning.description: Set to true if after a provisioning apn the radio should be restarted

config_reverseDefaultRotation.title: The config_reverseDefaultRotation Schema
config_reverseDefaultRotation.description: If true, the direction rotation is applied to get to an application's requested&#10;orientation is reversed.  Normally, the model is that landscape is&#10;clockwise from portrait; thus on a portrait device an app requesting&#10;landscape will cause a clockwise rotation, and on a landscape device an&#10;app requesting portrait will cause a counter-clockwise rotation.  Setting&#10;true here reverses that logic.

config_safe_media_volume_enabled.title: The config_safe_media_volume_enabled Schema
config_safe_media_volume_enabled.description: Whether safe headphone volume is enabled or not (country specific).

config_safe_media_volume_index.title: The config_safe_media_volume_index Schema
config_safe_media_volume_index.description: Safe headphone volume index. When music stream volume is below this index&#10;    the SPL on headphone output is compliant to EN 60950 requirements for portable music&#10;    players.

config_safeModeDisabledVibePattern.title: The config_safeModeDisabledVibePattern Schema
config_safeModeDisabledVibePattern.description: Vibrator pattern for feedback about booting with safe mode disabled

config_safeModeEnabledVibePattern.title: The config_safeModeEnabledVibePattern Schema
config_safeModeEnabledVibePattern.description: Vibrator pattern for feedback about booting with safe mode disabled

config_sameNamedOperatorConsideredRoamin.title: The config_sameNamedOperatorConsideredRoaming Schema
config_sameNamedOperatorConsideredRoamin.description: This is NOT just for same named operators unlike the name suggests (will blacklist regardless of name).&#10;A match on this supersedes a match on config_operatorConsideredNonRoaming.&#10;Uses &quot;startsWith&quot; so you can use a leading substring like the mcc or&#10;use the complete mcc+mnc string.&#10;For a given mcc/mcc-mnc, some operators may want to roam (even if&#10;config_operatorConsideredNonRoaming has the mcc/mcc-mnc).&#10;user of 40485 should see the roaming icon as using 40483 network&#10;though same Reliance network.&#10;To do this, add 40483 item to values-mcc404-mnc85/config.xml

config_screen_magnification_multi_tap_ad.title: The config_screen_magnification_multi_tap_adjustment Schema
config_screen_magnification_multi_tap_ad.description: Time adjustment, in milliseconds, applied to the default double tap threshold&#10;used for gesture detection by the screen magnifier.

config_screenAutoBrightnessDozeScaleFact.title: The config_screenAutoBrightnessDozeScaleFactor Schema
config_screenAutoBrightnessDozeScaleFact.description: If we allow automatic adjustment of screen brightness while dozing, how many times we want&#10;to reduce it to preserve the battery. Value of 100% means no scaling.

config_screenBrightnessDark.title: The config_screenBrightnessDark Schema
config_screenBrightnessDark.description: Minimum allowable screen brightness to use in a very dark room.&#10;This value sets the floor for the darkest possible auto-brightness&#10;adjustment.  It is expected to be somewhat less than the first entry in&#10;config_autoBrightnessLcdBacklightValues so as to allow the user to have&#10;some range of adjustment to dim the screen further than usual in very&#10;dark rooms. The contents of the screen must still be clearly visible&#10;in darkness (although they may not be visible in a bright room).

config_screenBrightnessDim.title: The config_screenBrightnessDim Schema
config_screenBrightnessDim.description: Screen brightness used to dim the screen when the user activity&#10;timeout expires.  May be less than the minimum allowed brightness setting&#10;that can be set by the user.

config_screenBrightnessDoze.title: The config_screenBrightnessDoze Schema
config_screenBrightnessDoze.description: Screen brightness used to dim the screen while dozing in a very low power state.&#10;May be less than the minimum allowed brightness setting&#10;that can be set by the user.

config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingDefau.title: The config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingDefault Schema
config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingDefau.description: Default screen brightness for VR setting.

config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMaxim.title: The config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMaximum Schema
config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMaxim.description: Maximum screen brightness setting allowed for VR.

config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMinim.title: The config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMinimum Schema
config_screenBrightnessForVrSettingMinim.description: Minimum screen brightness setting allowed for VR. Device panels start increasing pulse&#10;width as brightness decreases below this theshold.

config_screenBrightnessSettingDefault.title: The config_screenBrightnessSettingDefault Schema
config_screenBrightnessSettingDefault.description: Default screen brightness setting.&#10;Must be in the range specified by minimum and maximum.

config_screenBrightnessSettingMaximum.title: The config_screenBrightnessSettingMaximum Schema
config_screenBrightnessSettingMaximum.description: Maximum screen brightness allowed by the power manager.&#10;The user is forbidden from setting the brightness above this level.

config_screenBrightnessSettingMinimum.title: The config_screenBrightnessSettingMinimum Schema
config_screenBrightnessSettingMinimum.description: Minimum screen brightness setting allowed by the power manager.&#10;The user is forbidden from setting the brightness below this level.

config_scrollBarrierVibePattern.title: The config_scrollBarrierVibePattern Schema
config_scrollBarrierVibePattern.description: Vibrator pattern for feedback about hitting a scroll barrier

config_send_sms1x_on_voice_call.title: The config_send_sms1x_on_voice_call Schema
config_send_sms1x_on_voice_call.description: Configuration to send sms on 1x when UE is attached to eHRPD and there is an active&#10;1xRTT voice call, irrespective of IMS registration state

config_sendAudioBecomingNoisy.title: The config_sendAudioBecomingNoisy Schema
config_sendAudioBecomingNoisy.description: Flag indicating whether the AUDIO_BECOMING_NOISY notification should&#10;be sent during a change to the audio output device.

config_serialPorts.title: The config_serialPorts Schema
config_serialPorts.description: List of paths to serial ports that are available to the serial manager.&#10;for example, /dev/ttyUSB0&#10;

config_sf_limitedAlpha.title: The config_sf_limitedAlpha Schema
config_sf_limitedAlpha.description: Flag indicating whether the surface flinger has limited&#10;alpha compositing functionality in hardware.  If set, the window&#10;manager will disable alpha trasformation in animations where not&#10;strictly needed.

config_sf_slowBlur.title: The config_sf_slowBlur Schema
config_sf_slowBlur.description: Flag indicating whether the surface flinger is inefficient&#10;at performing a blur.  Used by parts of the UI to turn off&#10;the blur effect where it isn't worth the performance hit.&#10;As of Honeycomb, blurring is not supported anymore.

config_shortAnimTime.title: The config_shortAnimTime Schema
config_shortAnimTime.description: The duration (in milliseconds) of a short animation.

config_shortPressOnPowerBehavior.title: The config_shortPressOnPowerBehavior Schema
config_shortPressOnPowerBehavior.description: Control the behavior when the user short presses the power button.&#10;   0 - Nothing&#10;   1 - Go to sleep (doze)&#10;   2 - Really go to sleep (don't doze)&#10;   3 - Really go to sleep and go home (don't doze)&#10;

config_shortPressOnSleepBehavior.title: The config_shortPressOnSleepBehavior Schema
config_shortPressOnSleepBehavior.description: Control the behavior when the user presses the sleep button.&#10;   0 - Go to sleep (doze)&#10;   1 - Go to sleep (doze) and go home&#10;

config_showMenuShortcutsWhenKeyboardPres.title: The config_showMenuShortcutsWhenKeyboardPresent Schema
config_showMenuShortcutsWhenKeyboardPres.description: Sets whether menu shortcuts should be displayed on panel menus when&#10;a keyboard is present.

config_showNavigationBar.title: The config_showNavigationBar Schema
config_showNavigationBar.description: Whether a software navigation bar should be shown. NOTE: in the future this may be&#10;autodetected from the Configuration.

config_showOperatorNameInStatusBar.title: The config_showOperatorNameInStatusBar Schema
config_showOperatorNameInStatusBar.description: Enables the feature that can show/hide the operator name in statusbar.&#10;        When true, the user can select to show/hide operator name through a&#10;        checkbox in Settings. When false, there is no option to show operator&#10;        name (no checkbox in Settings).

config_shutdownBatteryTemperature.title: The config_shutdownBatteryTemperature Schema
config_shutdownBatteryTemperature.description: Shutdown if the battery temperature exceeds (this value * 0.1) Celsius.

config_sim_phonebook_batch_operation.title: The config_sim_phonebook_batch_operation Schema
config_sim_phonebook_batch_operation.description: Configuartion to support SIM contact batch operation.

config_sms_capable.title: The config_sms_capable Schema
config_sms_capable.description: Flag indicating whether the current device allows sms service.&#10;If true, this means that the device supports both sending and&#10;receiving sms via the telephony network.&#10;This can be overridden to false for &quot;data only&quot; devices&#10;which can't send and receive sms message.&#10;&#10;Note: Disable SMS also disable voicemail waiting sms,&#10;      cell broadcasting sms, and MMS.

config_sms_convert_destination_number_su.title: The config_sms_convert_destination_number_support Schema
config_sms_convert_destination_number_su.description: This config is used to check if the carrier requires converting destination&#10;number before sending out a SMS.&#10;Formats for this configuration as below:&#10;[true or false][;optional gid]&#10;The logic to pick up the configuration:&#10;(1) If the &quot;config_sms_convert_destination_number_support&quot; array has no gid&#10;    special item, the last one will be picked&#10;(2) If the &quot;config_sms_convert_destination_number_support&quot; array has gid special&#10;    item and it matches the current sim's gid, it will be picked.&#10;(3) If the &quot;config_sms_convert_destination_number_support&quot; array has gid special&#10;    item but it doesn't match the current sim's gid, the last one without gid&#10;    will be picked

config_sms_decode_gsm_8bit_data.title: The config_sms_decode_gsm_8bit_data Schema
config_sms_decode_gsm_8bit_data.description: Support decoding the user data payload as pack GSM 8-bit (a GSM alphabet&#10;        string that's stored in 8-bit unpacked format) characters.

config_sms_enabled_locking_shift_tables.title: The config_sms_enabled_locking_shift_tables Schema
config_sms_enabled_locking_shift_tables.description: National language locking shift tables to enable for SMS encoding.&#10;Decoding is always enabled. 3GPP TS 23.038 states that this feature&#10;should not be enabled until a formal request is issued by the relevant&#10;national regulatory body. Array elements are codes from the table above.&#10;Example 1: devices sold in Turkey must include table 1 after the&#10;  Turkish Telecommunication Authority requires locking shift encoding&#10;  to be enabled (est. July 2012). (http://www.btk.gov.tr/eng/pdf/2009/BY-LAW_SMS.pdf)&#10;  See also: http://www.mobitech.com.tr/tr/ersanozturkblog_en/index.php?entry=entry090223-160014&#10;Example 2: devices sold in India should include tables 4 through 13&#10;to enable use of the new Release 9 tables for Indic languages.

config_sms_enabled_single_shift_tables.title: The config_sms_enabled_single_shift_tables Schema
config_sms_enabled_single_shift_tables.description: National language single shift tables to enable for SMS encoding.&#10;Decoding is always enabled. 3GPP TS 23.038 states that this feature&#10;should not be enabled until a formal request is issued by the relevant&#10;national regulatory body. Array elements are codes from the table above.&#10;Example 1: devices sold in Turkey must include table 1 to conform with&#10;  By-Law Number 27230. (http://www.btk.gov.tr/eng/pdf/2009/BY-LAW_SMS.pdf)&#10;Example 2: devices sold in India should include tables 4 through 13&#10;  to enable use of the new Release 9 tables for Indic languages.

config_sms_utf8_support.title: The config_sms_utf8_support Schema
config_sms_utf8_support.description: If this value is true, Sms encoded as octet is decoded by utf8 decoder.&#10;If false, decoded by Latin decoder.

config_soundEffectVolumeDb.title: The config_soundEffectVolumeDb Schema
config_soundEffectVolumeDb.description: The attenuation in dB applied to the sound effects played&#10;through AudioManager.playSoundEffect() when no volume is specified.

config_speed_up_audio_on_mt_calls.title: The config_speed_up_audio_on_mt_calls Schema
config_speed_up_audio_on_mt_calls.description: Flag indicating if the speed up audio on mt call code should be executed

config_statusBarIcons.title: The config_statusBarIcons Schema
config_statusBarIcons.description: Do not translate. Defines the slots for the right-hand side icons.  That is to say, the&#10;icons in the status bar that are not notifications.

config_stkNoAlphaUsrCnf.title: The config_stkNoAlphaUsrCnf Schema
config_stkNoAlphaUsrCnf.description: set to false if we need to show user confirmation&#10;when alpha identifier is not provided by the UICC

config_strongAuthRequiredOnBoot.title: The config_strongAuthRequiredOnBoot Schema
config_strongAuthRequiredOnBoot.description: Enforce strong auth on boot. Setting this to false represents a security risk and should&#10;not be ordinarily done. The only case in which this might be permissible is in a car head&#10;unit where there are hardware mechanisms to protect the device (physical keys) and not&#10;much in the way of user data.&#10;

config_supportAudioSourceUnprocessed.title: The config_supportAudioSourceUnprocessed Schema
config_supportAudioSourceUnprocessed.description: Whether the Unprocessed audio source supports the required frequency range and level

config_supportAutoRotation.title: The config_supportAutoRotation Schema
config_supportAutoRotation.description: If true, enables auto-rotation features using the accelerometer.&#10;Otherwise, auto-rotation is disabled.  Applications may still request&#10;to use specific orientations but the sensor is ignored and sensor-based&#10;orientations are not available.  Furthermore, all auto-rotation related&#10;settings are omitted from the system UI.  In certain situations we may&#10;still use the accelerometer to determine the orientation, such as when&#10;docked if the dock is configured to enable the accelerometer.

config_supportDoubleTapWake.title: The config_supportDoubleTapWake Schema
config_supportDoubleTapWake.description: Whether device supports double tap to wake

config_supportLongPressPowerWhenNonInter.title: The config_supportLongPressPowerWhenNonInteractive Schema
config_supportLongPressPowerWhenNonInter.description: If this is true, long press on power button will be available from the non-interactive state

config_supportMicNearUltrasound.title: The config_supportMicNearUltrasound Schema
config_supportMicNearUltrasound.description: Whether the default microphone audio source supports near-ultrasound frequencies&#10;(range of 18 - 21 kHz).

config_supportPreRebootSecurityLogs.title: The config_supportPreRebootSecurityLogs Schema
config_supportPreRebootSecurityLogs.description: True if the device supports persisting security logs across reboots.&#10;This requires the device's kernel to have pstore and pmsg enabled,&#10;and DRAM to be powered and refreshed through all stages of reboot.

config_supportsMultiWindow.title: The config_supportsMultiWindow Schema
config_supportsMultiWindow.description: True if the device supports at least one form of multi-window.&#10;E.g. freeform, split-screen, picture-in-picture.

config_supportSpeakerNearUltrasound.title: The config_supportSpeakerNearUltrasound Schema
config_supportSpeakerNearUltrasound.description: Whether the default speaker audio output path supports near-ultrasound frequencies&#10;(range of 18 - 21 kHz).

config_supportSystemNavigationKeys.title: The config_supportSystemNavigationKeys Schema
config_supportSystemNavigationKeys.description: True if the device supports system navigation keys.

config_suspendWhenScreenOffDueToProximit.title: The config_suspendWhenScreenOffDueToProximity Schema
config_suspendWhenScreenOffDueToProximit.description: Indicate whether to allow the device to suspend when the screen is off&#10;due to the proximity sensor.  This resource should only be set to true&#10;if the sensor HAL correctly handles the proximity sensor as a wake-up source.&#10;Otherwise, the device may fail to wake out of suspend reliably.&#10;The default is false.

config_sustainedPerformanceModeSupported.title: The config_sustainedPerformanceModeSupported Schema
config_sustainedPerformanceModeSupported.description: True if the device supports Sustained Performance Mode

config_swipeDisambiguation.title: The config_swipeDisambiguation Schema
config_swipeDisambiguation.description: Enables swipe versus poly-finger touch disambiguation in the KeyboardView

config_switch_phone_on_voice_reg_state_c.title: The config_switch_phone_on_voice_reg_state_change Schema
config_switch_phone_on_voice_reg_state_c.description: Config determines whether to update phone object when voice registration&#10;state changes. Voice radio tech change will always trigger an update of&#10;phone object irrespective of this config

config_syncstorageengine_masterSyncAutom.title: The config_syncstorageengine_masterSyncAutomatically Schema
config_syncstorageengine_masterSyncAutom.description: The default value if the SyncStorageEngine should sync automatically or not

config_system_condition_providers.title: The config_system_condition_providers Schema
config_system_condition_providers.description: Enabled built-in zen mode condition providers

config_telephony_use_own_number_for_voic.title: The config_telephony_use_own_number_for_voicemail Schema
config_telephony_use_own_number_for_voic.description: The VoiceMail default value is displayed to my own number if it is true

config_telephonyHardware.title: The config_telephonyHardware Schema
config_telephonyHardware.description: an array of &quot;[hardware type],[hardware-uuid],[state],[[hardware-type specific]]&quot;&#10;with, [[hardware-type specific]] in:&#10;   - &quot;[[ril-model],[rat],[max-active-voice],[max-active-data],[max-active-standby]]&quot;&#10;     for 'modem' hardware&#10;   - &quot;[[associated-modem-uuid]]&quot;&#10;     for 'sim' hardware.&#10;refer to HardwareConfig in com.android.internal.telephony for specific details/values&#10;those elements can carry.&#10;

config_testLocationProviders.title: The config_testLocationProviders Schema
config_testLocationProviders.description: accuracy is defined in anroid.location.Criteria&#10;1 = ACCURACY_FINE / 2 = ACCURACY_COARSE

config_tether_apndata.title: The config_tether_apndata Schema
config_tether_apndata.description: String containing the apn value for tethering.  May be overriden by secure settings&#10;TETHER_DUN_APN.  Value is a comma separated series of strings:&#10;&quot;name,apn,proxy,port,username,password,server,mmsc,mmsproxy,mmsport,mcc,mnc,auth,type&quot;,&#10;Or string format of ApnSettingV3.&#10;note that empty fields can be ommitted: &quot;name,apn,,,,,,,,,310,260,,DUN&quot;&#10;Multiple entries are separated by using string-array:&#10;&quot;&lt;item&gt;[ApnSettingV3]Name,apn,,,,,,,,,123,45,,mms|*,IPV6,IP,true,14,,,,,,,spn,testspn&lt;/item&gt;&#10; &lt;item&gt;[ApnSettingV3]Name1,apn2,,,,,,,,,123,46,,mms|*,IPV6,IP,true,12,,,,,,,,&lt;/item&gt;&quot;

config_tether_bluetooth_regexs.title: The config_tether_bluetooth_regexs Schema
config_tether_bluetooth_regexs.description: List of regexpressions describing the interface (if any) that represent tetherable&#10;bluetooth interfaces.  If the device doesn't want to support tethering over bluetooth this&#10;should be empty.

config_tether_dhcp_range.title: The config_tether_dhcp_range Schema
config_tether_dhcp_range.description: Dhcp range (min, max) to use for tethering purposes

config_tether_upstream_types.title: The config_tether_upstream_types Schema
config_tether_upstream_types.description: Common options are [1, 4] for TYPE_WIFI and TYPE_MOBILE_DUN or&#10;    &lt;!== [0,1,5,7] for TYPE_MOBILE, TYPE_WIFI, TYPE_MOBILE_HIPRI and TYPE_BLUETOOTH

config_tether_usb_regexs.title: The config_tether_usb_regexs Schema
config_tether_usb_regexs.description: List of regexpressions describing the interface (if any) that represent tetherable&#10;USB interfaces.  If the device doesn't want to support tethering over USB this should&#10;be empty.  An example would be &quot;usb.*&quot;

config_tether_wifi_regexs.title: The config_tether_wifi_regexs Schema
config_tether_wifi_regexs.description: List of regexpressions describing the interface (if any) that represent tetherable&#10;Wifi interfaces.  If the device doesn't want to support tethering over Wifi this&#10;should be empty.  An example would be &quot;softap.*&quot;

config_tether_wimax_regexs.title: The config_tether_wimax_regexs Schema
config_tether_wimax_regexs.description: List of regexpressions describing the interface (if any) that represent tetherable&#10;WiMAX interfaces.  If the device doesn't want to support tethering over Wifi this&#10;should be empty.  An example would be &quot;softap.*&quot;

config_toastDefaultGravity.title: The config_toastDefaultGravity Schema
config_toastDefaultGravity.description: Default Gravity setting for the system Toast view. Equivalent to: Gravity.CENTER_HORIZONTAL | Gravity.BOTTOM

config_triplePressOnPowerBehavior.title: The config_triplePressOnPowerBehavior Schema
config_triplePressOnPowerBehavior.description: Control the behavior when the user triple presses the power button.&#10;   0 - Nothing&#10;   1 - Toggle theater mode setting&#10;   2 - Brightness boost&#10;

config_tvRemoteServicePackage.title: The config_tvRemoteServicePackage Schema
config_tvRemoteServicePackage.description: Package of the unbundled tv remote service which can connect to tv&#10;remote provider

config_twoDigitNumberPattern.title: The config_twoDigitNumberPattern Schema
config_twoDigitNumberPattern.description: Do not translate. Defines the slots is Two Digit Number for dialing normally not USSD

config_ui_enableFadingMarquee.title: The config_ui_enableFadingMarquee Schema
config_ui_enableFadingMarquee.description: Enables or disables fading edges when marquee is enabled in TextView.&#10;Off by default, since the framebuffer readback used to implement the&#10;fading edges is prohibitively expensive on most GPUs.

config_undockedHdmiRotation.title: The config_undockedHdmiRotation Schema
config_undockedHdmiRotation.description: The number of degrees to rotate the display when the device has HDMI connected&#10;but is not in a dock.  A value of -1 means no change in orientation by default.&#10;Use -1 except on older devices whose Hardware Composer HAL does not&#10;provide full support for multiple displays.

config_unplugTurnsOnScreen.title: The config_unplugTurnsOnScreen Schema
config_unplugTurnsOnScreen.description: If this is true, the screen will come on when you unplug usb/power/whatever.

config_usbChargingMessage.title: The config_usbChargingMessage Schema
config_usbChargingMessage.description: If this is true, the message that USB is only being used for charging will be shown.

config_usbHostBlacklist.title: The config_usbHostBlacklist Schema
config_usbHostBlacklist.description: List of file paths for USB host busses to exclude from USB host support.&#10;For example, if the first USB bus on the device is used to communicate&#10;with the modem or some other restricted hardware, add &quot;/dev/bus/usb/001/&quot;&#10;to this list.  If this is empty, no parts of the host USB bus will be excluded.&#10;

config_use_sim_language_file.title: The config_use_sim_language_file Schema
config_use_sim_language_file.description: flag to indicate if EF LI/EF PL should be used for system language

config_useAttentionLight.title: The config_useAttentionLight Schema
config_useAttentionLight.description: Set this true only if the device has separate attention and notification lights.

config_useDevInputEventForAudioJack.title: The config_useDevInputEventForAudioJack Schema
config_useDevInputEventForAudioJack.description: When true use the linux /dev/input/event subsystem to detect the switch changes&#10;on the headphone/microphone jack. When false use the older uevent framework.

config_useFixedVolume.title: The config_useFixedVolume Schema
config_useFixedVolume.description: Flag indicating that the media framework should not allow changes or mute on any&#10;stream or master volumes.

config_useNewSensorSamplesForDoze.title: The config_useNewSensorSamplesForDoze Schema
config_useNewSensorSamplesForDoze.description: This flag should be used with config_allowAutoBrightnessActiveDozeLightSensor set to true.&#10;&#10;The screen brightness of a device is based off of a ring buffer of the last n seconds of&#10;ambient light sensor sample readings.&#10;&#10;If this flag is true, then this buffer is cleared every time a new sample is taken in doze&#10;mode and the screen brightness is based off the new reading. This mode may be better suited&#10;for watches.&#10;&#10;If this flag is false, then this buffer is untouched.

config_user_notification_of_restrictied_.title: The config_user_notification_of_restrictied_mobile_access Schema
config_user_notification_of_restrictied_.description: Flag indicating if the user is notified when the mobile network access is restricted

config_useragentprofile_url.title: The config_useragentprofile_url Schema
config_useragentprofile_url.description: The URL that should be sent in an x-wap-profile header with an HTTP request,&#10;as defined in the Open Mobile Alliance User Agent Profile specification&#10;OMA-TS-UAProf-V2_0-20060206-A Section 8.1.1.1. If the URL contains a '%s'&#10;format string then that substring will be replaced with the value of&#10;Build.MODEL. The format string shall not be escaped.

config_useRoundIcon.title: The config_useRoundIcon Schema
config_useRoundIcon.description: Flag indicating whether round icons should be parsed from the application manifest.

config_useVolumeKeySounds.title: The config_useVolumeKeySounds Schema
config_useVolumeKeySounds.description: Flag indicating that the media framework should support playing of sounds on volume&#10;key usage.  This adds noticeable additional overhead to volume key processing, so&#10;is disableable for products for which it is irrelevant.

config_valid_wappush_index.title: The config_valid_wappush_index Schema
config_valid_wappush_index.description: For some operators, PDU has garbages. To fix it, need to use valid index

config_video_call_datausage_enable.title: The config_video_call_datausage_enable Schema
config_video_call_datausage_enable.description: Enable framework to record video call data usage

config_virtualKeyQuietTimeMillis.title: The config_virtualKeyQuietTimeMillis Schema
config_virtualKeyQuietTimeMillis.description: Specifies the amount of time to disable virtual keys after the screen is touched&#10;in order to filter out accidental virtual key presses due to swiping gestures&#10;or taps near the edge of the display.  May be 0 to disable the feature.&#10;It is recommended that this value be no more than 250 ms.&#10;This feature should be disabled for most devices.

config_virtualKeyVibePattern.title: The config_virtualKeyVibePattern Schema

config_voice_capable.title: The config_voice_capable Schema

This chipset&#10;capability can provide power savings when wifi needs to be always kept on.

For this to be true, there must exist&#10;a protected hardware path for surface flinger to composite and send&#10;protected buffers to the wifi display video encoder.&#10;&#10;If this flag is false, we advise applications not to use protected&#10;buffers (if possible) when presenting content to a wifi display because&#10;the content may be blanked.&#10;&#10;This flag controls whether the {@link Display#FLAG_SUPPORTS_PROTECTED_BUFFERS}&#10;flag is set for wifi displays.&#10;

db_connection_pool_size.title: The db_connection_pool_size Schema
db_connection_pool_size.description: Maximum number of database connections opened and managed by framework layer&#10;to handle queries on each database when using Write-Ahead Logging.

db_default_journal_mode.title: The db_default_journal_mode Schema
db_default_journal_mode.description: The default journal mode to use use when Write-Ahead Logging is not active.&#10;Choices are: OFF, DELETE, TRUNCATE, PERSIST and MEMORY.&#10;PERSIST may improve performance by reducing how often journal blocks are&#10;reallocated (compared to truncation) resulting in better data block locality&#10;and less churn of the storage media.

db_default_sync_mode.title: The db_default_sync_mode Schema
db_default_sync_mode.description: The database synchronization mode when using the default journal mode.&#10;FULL is safest and preserves durability at the cost of extra fsyncs.&#10;NORMAL also preserves durability in non-WAL modes and uses checksums to ensure&#10;integrity although there is a small chance that an error might go unnoticed.&#10;Choices are: FULL, NORMAL, OFF.

db_journal_size_limit.title: The db_journal_size_limit Schema
db_journal_size_limit.description: Maximum size of the persistent journal file in bytes.&#10;If the journal file grows to be larger than this amount then SQLite will&#10;truncate it after committing the transaction.

db_wal_autocheckpoint.title: The db_wal_autocheckpoint Schema
db_wal_autocheckpoint.description: The Write-Ahead Log auto-checkpoint interval in database pages (typically 1 to 4KB).&#10;The log is checkpointed automatically whenever it exceeds this many pages.&#10;When a database is reopened, its journal mode is set back to the default&#10;journal mode, which may cause a checkpoint operation to occur.  Checkpoints&#10;can also happen at other times when transactions are committed.&#10;The bigger the WAL file, the longer a checkpoint operation takes, so we try&#10;to keep the WAL file relatively small to avoid long delays.&#10;The size of the WAL file is also constrained by 'db_journal_size_limit'.

db_wal_sync_mode.title: The db_wal_sync_mode Schema
db_wal_sync_mode.description: The database synchronization mode when using Write-Ahead Logging.&#10;FULL is safest and preserves durability at the cost of extra fsyncs.&#10;NORMAL sacrifices durability in WAL mode because syncs are only performed before&#10;and after checkpoint operations.  If checkpoints are infrequent and power loss&#10;occurs, then committed transactions could be lost and applications might break.&#10;Choices are: FULL, NORMAL, OFF.

default_browser.title: The default_browser Schema
default_browser.description: Default web browser.  This is the package name of the application that will&#10;be the default browser when the device first boots.  Afterwards the user&#10;can select whatever browser app they wish to use as the default.&#10;&#10;If this string is empty or the specified package does not exist, then&#10;the behavior will be as though no app was named as an explicit default.

default_sms_application.title: The default_sms_application Schema
default_sms_application.description: Default SMS Application. This will be the default SMS application when&#10;the phone first boots. The user can then change the default app to one&#10;of their choosing.&#10;This can be overridden for devices where a different default SMS&#10;application is desired.&#10;&#10;If this string is empty or the specified package does not exist, then&#10;the platform will search for an SMS app and use that (if there is one)

This config is used to set which carrier doesn't&#10;support EMS and whether page info should be added at the beginning or the end.&#10;We use tag 'prefix' for position beginning and 'suffix' for position end.&#10;And use gid to distinguish different carriers which using same mcc and mnc.&#10;Examples: &lt;item&gt;simOperatorNumber;position;gid(optional)&lt;/item&gt;&gt;&#10;

config_install_prompt_package.title: The config_install_prompt_package Schema
config_install_prompt_package.description: &#10;    The package name of the application to handle installing of FOTA updates. The specified package&#10;    will be in charge of determining when to do the install. A broadcast will be sent to the package&#10;    for the following intent-filter when it would have normally tried to install the update, so&#10;    any install times or check frequencies will still be in effect:&#10;&#10;    &lt;intent-filter&gt;&#10;      &lt;action android:name=&quot;com.bymason.platform.INSTALL_UPDATE&quot; /&gt;&#10;    &lt;/intent-filter&gt;&#10;&#10;    It is then up to the application specified by this config to communicate when it is ready to do&#10;    an install by calling masonamerica.platform.FotaManagerPriv#requestInstall(uuid)&#10;&#10;    If for some reason this package is not valid, it will default to the usual configured behavior.&#10;    There should only ever be a single system update, so whenever a uuid is provided, any previous&#10;    one may be discarded. Once the requestInstall() is called, the uuid should be discarded.&#10;&#10;    Defaults to an empty string.&#10;

config_update_check_frequency.title: The config_update_check_frequency Schema
config_update_check_frequency.description: &#10;    The frequency for which to check for updates from boot, default is 24 hours&#10;

config_update_check_network_type.title: The config_update_check_network_type Schema
config_update_check_network_type.description: &#10;    NETWORK_TYPE_ANY&#10;    The default update check network type, allows checks over any network&#10;    Constant Value: 1 (0x00000001)&#10;&#10;    NETWORK_TYPE_UNMETERED&#10;    The update check requires network connectivity that is unmetered.&#10;    Constant Value: 2 (0x00000002)&#10;&#10;    NETWORK_TYPE_NOT_ROAMING&#10;    The update check requires network connectivity that is not roaming.&#10;    Constant Value: 3 (0x00000003)&#10;

autogrant_runtime_permissions_packages.title: The autogrant_runtime_permissions_packages Schema
autogrant_runtime_permissions_packages.description: Android does not always grant all permissions requested by an application in its&#10;    Android manifest. For instance, runtime permissions (or permissions marked as&#10;    &quot;development&quot;) are never granted automatically. A common development-time workaround&#10;    is to assign such permissions to applications via `adb shell pm grant &lt;pkg&gt; &lt;perm&gt;`.&#10;&#10;    This configuration value specifies an array of package names of apps that wish to be&#10;    granted such permissions automatically without requiring the use of `adb`. Note that&#10;    each of the applications corresponding to the packages indicated below must specify&#10;    each of these permissions also within their manifest (AndroidManifest.xml) for this&#10;    to work correctly.&#10;&#10;    Use with care as this allows for privilege escalation.&#10;

config_global_proxy.title: The config_global_proxy Schema
config_global_proxy.description: Value indicating the network-independent global HTTP proxy of the type specified&#10;`config_global_proxy_type`. See the documentation for `config_global_proxy_type`&#10;for more information.&#10;

config_global_proxy_type.title: The config_global_proxy_type Schema
config_global_proxy_type.description: Sets a network-independent global HTTP proxy of a given type. This is useful&#10;for general internal/corporation-wide filtering scenarios. On a private network&#10;where the proxy is NOT accessible for any reason, this could break HTTP on a&#10;device. This value is ignored if `config_global_proxy` is not set.&#10;&#10;Allowed values are:&#10;&#10;'direct' - Specifies a direct proxy via host and port. It requires specification of&#10;  `config_global_proxy` and parses the latter as `host[:port]`&#10;'pac'    - This is used to specify proxy auto-config (PAC). It requires specification&#10;  of `config_global_proxy` and parses the latter as a URL to a PAC file.&#10;'none'   - This is the same as not specifying this configuration at all. The value of&#10;  `config_global_proxy`, if set, is ignored. This is the default.&#10;&#10;NOTE: Typical HTTP proxies are generally network dependent. This setting is not&#10;on a per-network basis, but rather has a global effect.&#10;&#10;NOTE 2: This proxy is only a recommendation and it is possible that some apps,&#10;especially native apps or those that use custom HTTP client implementations&#10;will ignore it.&#10;&#10;@see https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/admin/DevicePolicyManager#setRecommendedGlobalProxy(android.content.ComponentName,%20android.net.ProxyInfo)&#10;@see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Proxy_servers_and_tunneling/Proxy_Auto-Configuration_(PAC)_file&#10;

default_keyboard_package.title: The default_keyboard_package Schema
default_keyboard_package.description: The package name of the keyboard to set as the default keyboard. The package&#10;     name must refer to a valid Android application that follows the standard Android&#10;     mechanism for declaring input methods.

default_runtime_permissions_grant_policy.title: The default_runtime_permissions_grant_policy Schema
default_runtime_permissions_grant_policy.description: Sets the default permission grant policy for future runtime permission requests&#10;    by apps that are installed either via config deployments, app deployments or `adb`.&#10;&#10;    Allowed values are:&#10;&#10;    'autogrant': Permission policy to always grant new permission requests for runtime&#10;        permissions. Already granted or denied permissions are not affected.&#10;    'autodeny' : Permission policy to always deny new permission requests for runtime&#10;        permissions. Already granted or denied permissions are not affected.&#10;    'prompt'   : Permission policy to always prompt the user for new permission requests&#10;        for runtime permissions. Already granted or denied permissions are not&#10;        affected.&#10;&#10;    NOTE: If this configuration key is omitted or has an invalid value, it defaults&#10;    to 'prompt'.&#10;&#10;    See also: `autogrant_runtime_permissions_packages`&#10;

direct_boot_package.title: The direct_boot_package Schema
direct_boot_package.description: The package name of the application to directly launch upon boot. The package&#10;     name must refer to a valid Android application that follows the standard Android&#10;     mechanism to mark a single &quot;launchable&quot; activity in its manifest.&#10;

config_status_bar_scrim_behind_use_src.title: The config_status_bar_scrim_behind_use_src Schema
config_status_bar_scrim_behind_use_src.description: Whether we should use SRC drawing mode when drawing the scrim behind. If this flag is set,&#10;we change the canvas opacity so libhwui doesn't call glClear on our surface, and then we&#10;draw the scrim with SRC to overwrite the whole buffer, which saves us a layer of overdraw.&#10;However, SRC performs poorly on some devices, where it is more efficient to&#10;glClear + SRC_OVER, in which case this flag should be disabled.

doze_pickup_subtype_performs_proximity_c.title: The doze_pickup_subtype_performs_proximity_check Schema
doze_pickup_subtype_performs_proximity_c.description: Doze: a list of pickup sensor subtypes that perform a proximity check before they trigger.&#10;      If not empty, either * or !* must appear to specify the default.&#10;      If empty, falls back to doze_pickup_performs_proximity_check.&#10;&#10;      Examples: 1,2,3,!* -&gt; subtypes 1,2 and 3 perform the check, all others don't.&#10;       !1,!2,*  -&gt; subtypes 1 and 2 don't perform the check, all others do.&#10;       !8,*     -&gt; subtype 8 does not perform the check, all others do&#10;       1,1,*    -&gt; illegal, every item may only appear once&#10;       1,!1,*   -&gt; illegal, no contradictions allowed&#10;       1,2      -&gt; illegal, need either * or !*&#10;       1,,4a3   -&gt; illegal, no empty or non-numeric terms allowed&#10;

status_bar_style.description: style of status bar:&#10;        0: Default Android style&#10;        1: Show data activity with data type at the left side of&#10;  signal icon, and signal icon may be two icons&#10;  stacked, the upper one is to show 3G, and the lower one&#10;  is to show 2G.&#10;        2: Do not show data activity besides signal icon, instead,&#10;  it shows data activity within signal view.&#10;        3: Show data activity with data type at the left side&#10;  of signal icon, and do not show two stacked icon on&#10;  one slot.&#10;        4: Show LTE, LTE+ symbols on top of signal icon,&#10;  and shows IMS and embms icons on the left side&#10;  of the signal icon.&#10;
